TF027085-PHRD -FINANCIAL SECTOR
            STRENGTHENING PROJECT,TF051360-PHRD-PARAGUAY: FINANCIAL SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT LOAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Programmatic Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project of Paraguay had the following
            ratings: outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was substantial, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and borrower performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory. The lessons learned included: 1)
            The Bank needs to strike a better balance between Program
            goals, the design of Program instruments, and a
            country's political realities; 2) The complexity of
            design and the number of operations in a Program should be
            consistent with the risks to development outcomes; 3) It is
            best to be more conservative in assessing borrower's
            capacity to implement reforms and thus be less ambitious in
            Program design; 4) and 4) Financial sector reform Programs
            aimed at reducing systemic vulnerabilities need to be
            inclusive of all important sectors.
